title: No grandstanding and getting on with the job, England's win could be this team's Wellington 2003 moment
text:
There might at least have been a punch of the air, a dab of triumphalism, some hoopla and hollering, a sneaky look-forward to Trafalgar Square celebrations or the bookings to come on the after-dinner circuit. If there was one thing that told you that this England resurgent moment is for real and that it will last, it is that it was greeted with… well, not very much.

Eddie Jones, sparky, snarky ringmaster of the verbals, could only parrot the ‘each day as it comes,’ line an hour after the final whistle had sounded at the International Stadium in Yokohama. It was reminiscent of the time several of us gathered round Martin Johnson in the bowels of the Westpac Stadium in Wellington shortly after...
description: There might at least have been a punch of the air, a dab of triumphalism, some hoopla and hollering, a sneaky look-forward to Trafalgar Square celebrations or the bookings to come on the after-dinner circuit.
